{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3295986,"name":"Brode","username":"Brodelydick","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T20:53:10.878Z","cooked":"

We are thinking about using the Andy mark poly bet for transitioning our note to the shooter. We are having concerns with the belt breaking where you have to weld it together does anyone have any ideas about how we could reinforce it?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T20:53:10.878Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":195,"reads":319,"readers_count":318,"score":1053.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Brode","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63726,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3295987,"name":"Keith Farelle Cozart","username":"ChiefK33f","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a3d4f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T20:53:42.715Z","cooked":"

Whats the reason for not using timing belt?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T20:53:42.715Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":319,"readers_count":318,"score":83.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Keith Farelle Cozart","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63625,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296019,"name":"Brode","username":"Brodelydick","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T21:30:54.905Z","cooked":"

One of our mentors is adamant on using polybelt

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T21:30:54.905Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":301,"readers_count":300,"score":70.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Brode","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63625,"username":"ChiefK33f","name":"Keith Farelle Cozart","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a3d4f5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63726,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296025,"name":"Zach Fowler","username":"Fowler509","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/c37758/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T21:43:37.436Z","cooked":"

I’m going out on a limb here but a properly welded poly belt with correctly sized crowned rollers is not going to break unless something else is wrong. I don’t think you need to reinforce the weld to make it stronger, the weld is similar in strength to the rest of the belt.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T21:45:15.041Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":282,"readers_count":281,"score":136.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Zach Fowler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63726,"username":"Brodelydick","name":"Brode","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/e8c25b/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31373,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296027,"name":"Aditya Challagulla","username":"Aditya1512","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T21:45:33.883Z","cooked":"

Not sure if your mentor should be the one making that descision, but if uniformity is not a super big priority you, and you truly are worried about it breaking, which I dont really see as a risk, you can maybe cut slivers of the belt and use it to reinforce the joint.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T21:45:33.883Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":275,"readers_count":274,"score":55.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Aditya Challagulla","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61742,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296028,"name":"Joe Derrick","username":"Joe_Derrick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_derrick/{size}/6055_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T21:46:20.414Z","cooked":"

. We have welded with a heat gun and a jig with no issue. Check out 111’s intake last year. Classic example

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T21:46:20.414Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":267,"readers_count":266,"score":53.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Joe Derrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"LakerBots 8046"},"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/6","custom_user_title":"LakerBots 8046","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296061,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T22:42:48.233Z","cooked":"
WildStang Robotics Program: Team 111 and 112 Build Blog - 2023 Robot Showcase
Polybelt Welding: Polybelt is a staple of Wildstang robots, being used almost every single year. Because of this, we’ve developed and refined a process which allows us to cut and weld polybelt in an accurate, repeatable way. Materials: Butane Torch Scissors Flush Cutters Polybelt Welding Jig (Pictured Below) Sink [image] Procedure: Cut the polybelt to the desired length, this should be ~5% shorter than the belt length in CAD. It is critical that the cut is both straight and square, so we…

We made a tutorial on how to weld polybelt last year. We didn’t have issues with our polybelt breaking.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T22:42:48.233Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":243,"readers_count":242,"score":63.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Eliot Dunn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/wildstang-robotics-program-team-111-and-112-build-blog-2023/420243/222","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"WildStang Robotics Program: Team 111 and 112 Build Blog - 2023","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52966,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"111 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/7","custom_user_title":"111 Alum","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296073,"name":"Mr V","username":"Mr_V","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr_v/{size}/5363_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T23:08:59.394Z","cooked":"

We’ve run poly belts for years, both flat and round and haven’t had any welds, that were done right, break. For flat belt we weld at a 45 degree angle to spread the load over a larger area.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T23:08:59.394Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":44.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Mr V","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15858,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296081,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T23:28:39.834Z","cooked":"

While this is the first time we’re using flat, we’ve used round a lot and have no concerns with the weld breaking. We’ve taken round belt and pulled as hard as we could on the weld without it breaking in the past!

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T23:28:39.834Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":196,"readers_count":195,"score":44.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/9","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296111,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-28T00:39:33.384Z","cooked":"

At least in FTC 2021 which had gamepieces made of a similar material, timing belts did not have great grips on the rings

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-28T00:39:33.384Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":33.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63625,"username":"ChiefK33f","name":"Keith Farelle Cozart","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a3d4f5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296117,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-28T00:49:51.894Z","cooked":"

Timing belts really aren’t good substitutes. For one, they don’t really stretch as much as poly belt. Second, they only come in specific sizes and require specific-sized pulleys. Third, they’re more expensive fourth, they’re generally not as wide. Fifth, polybelt is generally a bit grippier.

OP: polybelt is easy to weld.and, unless you’re really stretching them, they aren’t going to come apart at the weld. You need a heat gun and an easy jig.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-28T00:49:51.894Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"CEF","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63625,"username":"ChiefK33f","name":"Keith Farelle Cozart","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a3d4f5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296147,"name":"Nick Foote","username":"Footie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/footie/{size}/218325_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-28T01:37:55.187Z","cooked":"

We’ve had this hot knife in our shop for longer than our team has been around, and it works great. You press both ends against either side, and when it’s melted enough, you raise them both up and smush 'em together. Actually touching the entire surface of the cut ensures that the whole thing is welded all the way through, not just on the outer surface.

wirecare.com

Bench Mount Hot Knife-110v.

The most popular form of hot knife, this Bench Mounted Hot Knife has 100 volts of electricity being converted into heat to cleanly cut sleeving or other items.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-28T01:37:55.187Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":43.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Nick Foote","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.wirecare.com/category/tools/hot-knife/bench-mount-hot-knives/hkb0-00wh-bench-mount-hot-knife-110v","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Bench Mount Hot Knife-110v. - WireCare.com","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student"},"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/12","custom_user_title":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296151,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-28T01:43:06.553Z","cooked":"
Brodelydick:

One of our mentors is adamant

While this is a reason, you should ask your mentor to explain why. Not as if you are questioning their judgement, but you want to know why so you can use polybelt where it’s appropriate. There’s probably a logical reason, they just need to explain it. That’s why they are there. This is a great learning opportunity if you ask nicely

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-01-28T01:43:16.404Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452316,"topic_slug":"reinforcing-poly-belt","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/reinforcing-poly-belt/452316/13","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3296152,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-28T01:44:27.515Z","cooked":"

If we’re going to get into tooling… we use this one, and it works great!

Practical Parts

Standard Urethane Belt Welding Kit

Urethane Belt Welding Clamp Features Capable of joining all shapes of urethane belts up to 2 inches in width and 1/2 inch in thickness V grooves for easy alignment Significantly less expensive than other welding tools on the market Enables...

Price: USD 129.00

Most of the tools folks use don’t have any temperature control and lead to burned belts, nasty smells, and charred plastic in the joint.

This isn’t a super-friendly part to handle, but it does a GREAT job on wide belts: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07GTMPW3M/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1 It runs up to the correct temperature and STAYS THERE. The positive temperature coefficient heater means you just need to apply power. I made a 3DP splicing jig that will make a 2" belt splice you -literally- can’t break.

I made a really fancy handle for that element, but you -can- just solder and heat shrink on a power cable. Bonus points if you ground the Aluminum can. My first half-**** try used a wire wrapped around the external groove for a ground. The fancy one uses SST TIG welding rod going into a Teflon block to both mount and ground it.

@Ryan_Dognaux I wonder if someone could offer these suckers with a proper cable and handle? Or if Practical Parts could be interested in a better heat device
